name: Roadsigns
description:
August 3rd, 199X

Gambel authorities have yet to identify a suspect for the recent murder of David Q— (25), leaving the small tourist town shaken with uncertainty. Frustrated by a lack of progress, Q—‘s family have hired a private investigator to help. Despite criticisms from skeptics, the investigator claims he can “replay” memories which took place on the night of the murder. Q—‘s funeral will take place early next week…

Search a remote mountain town for clues about an unsolved murder. And use your causal reasoning to derive new insight by sequencing these clues. But as your reason falters, so too does your memory of each event, blending hard facts with vague impressions. With a thickening mental fog, you only have so much time before the killer is lost forever.

But at what point do the rules of storytelling override our better judgement?

Features
  • Explore a remote mountain town by car
  • Relive memories to gain new leads
  • Sequence conversations to derive insight
  • Process misleading clues and muddled dialogue
  • Uncover secrets before your vision fades
Installing

Extract the zip file and run Roadsigns.exe (for Windows) or Roadsigns.app (for macOS).

Trial version

If you don’t know whether Roadsigns is the game for you, download and play the free demo below. To install it, extract the zip file and run RoadsignsDemo.exe (for Windows) or RoadsignsDemo.app (for macOS).
